Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 6/6/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the facility's audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
All staff interviewed reported a positive experience working with the youth at the
facility. They believed the administration is very supportive and provided the level
and type of training necessary to help the youth in care.
All 7-youth interviewed reported feeling safe at the facility and well cared for by
staff. Each believed the staff were invested in their well-being and staff supervised

their actions. All reported receiving services such as counseling, activities, and
medical to meet their needs.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is a single-story facility divided into the detention space and treatment space.
Currently, there is no inhouse treatment being provided and only the detention
section is operational. The facility is well maintained and clean. The plumbing is
working appropriately, and all items required to be locked are locked. The kitchen
is clean, and the menu is posted for youth to observe. The employee items are
also posited in the employee area. Bedrooms are furnished as required.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
